basic.description: This course involves the completion of an Honors Undergraduate Research Program (URP) for six hours with a minimum grade of "C". This program requires independent student research on a topic relevant to biomedical engineering and may be used to satisfy the Chemical Engineering Elective requirement. May be repeated to a maximum of six semester hours. May be repeated within the same semester.
basic.subject: BME
basic.title: Honors URP in Biomedical Engineering

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: BME 4403C, CHM 4410, ECH 3101, ECH 3266, ECH 3854, a 3.2 GPA and instructor permission. Corequisites: ECH 3274L, ECH 3418, and ECH 4267.
